meanings.definition: Breed (an animal) with one not of the same strain or family.
meanings.sent1: She outcrosses her cat with a different breed to get unique kittens.
meanings.sent2: The farmer outcrosses his cows with bulls from other farms to improve the herd.
meanings.sent3: The dog outcrosses playfully with the neighbor's pet, creating a furry friendship.
meanings.sent4: The idea outcrosses boundaries, blending creativity with tradition.
meanings.sent5: Outcrosses bring new bloodlines into the population, ensuring diversity.

meanings.definition: The act of breeding an animal with one not of the same strain or family.
meanings.sent1: The outcrosses in the kennel resulted in puppies with unique traits.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use outcrosses to introduce new genes into their livestock.
meanings.sent3: The outcrosses at the zoo led to unexpected animal hybrids.
meanings.sent4: In the world of plants, outcrosses create vibrant and diverse gardens.
meanings.sent5: Outcrosses are essential for maintaining genetic variability in populations.
